channel.title: Bot problem
channel.description:
This is a problem with all programs that run runescape outside of the browser window. This output is available from Frame.getFrames() -> toString() Frame is static and runescape code is usally final so overriding won't work - also if you do it will break a lot. Hope some one can figure it out or we won't be able to see the bot in action - all frames from the same java instance will be "seen". Hacking the entire java runtime code does not look like a viable option.
[code]JFrame: javax.swing.JFrame[frame0,0,0,119x65,invalid,layout=java.awt.BorderLayout,title=Aryan,resizable,normal,defaultCloseOperation=HIDE_ON_CLOSE,rootPane=javax.swing.JRootPane[,5,26,109x34,invalid,layout=javax.swing.JRootPane$RootLayout,alignmentX=0.0,alignmentY=0.0,border=,flags=16777673,maximumSize=,minimumSize=,preferredSize=],rootPaneCheckingEnabled=true]
AppletViewer: aun.applet.AppletViewer[frame0,0,0,810x177,invalid,layout=java.awt.BorderLayout,title=Applet Viewer: myApp.class,resizable,normal]
Firefox(Linux): sun.plugin.viewer.frame.XNetscapeEmbeddedFrame[frame2,0,0,800x100,invalid,layout=java.awt.BorderLayout,title=,resizable,normal][/code]
imp: I thought it was undetectable - enlighten me.

item.title: Bot problem
item.dc:creator: @Nerice Nerice
item.description:
@Nerice wrote:

Krichevskoy, no they dont. No doubt about it, its checked, they dont toString() the frame.

Checking if something like that is done is very easy.

Read full topic

item.title: Bot problem
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

[quote=“kmb, post:6, topic:3644”][quote author=popcorn89 link=topic=4421.msg44075#msg44075 date=1149604449]

Or you can not edit the client at all.

Well I suppose we could just sit at our computers 24/7 and get all our stats up to 99 the legit way. Bot making would be more fun though!
[/quote]
I think he meant bytecode hacking. :|[/quote]

Bytecode hacking is still editing the client, I guess he meant a passive system?

The “problem” has been mentioned before, but no one has every said if they actually do it?

Read full topic

item.title: Bot problem
item.dc:creator: @Nerice Nerice
item.description:
@Nerice wrote:

They dont try what the OP pointed out anyway. ka.x is where its stored this update, its easy to get where its stored at, and to check to see if they try… and if they do, to fix it.

Read full topic

item.title: Bot problem

item.description:

i get around this issue by not putting it in a Frame not a JFrame.

item.title: Bot problem
item.dc:creator: @Nerice Nerice
item.description:
@Nerice wrote:

Sorry to bring up an old post but, its obvious if they are checking this via bytecode, and since it should not be in a frame… null works well. They have to catch it and deal with the NPE as it should be null anyway.

Read full topic

item.title: Bot problem
item.dc:creator: @93dcthugs93 93dcthugs93
item.description:
@93dcthugs93 wrote:

[quote=“doomsday, post:15, topic:3644”][quote author=kmb link=topic=4421.msg44474#msg44474 date=1149694147]

so how come you cant just edit your client to say that its running from the rs website

if im reading this correctly(im just a newbie at java)

the server is the check if its running from www.runescape.com, so can you just make your client reply with yes sir, i am running from www.runescape.com?

For someone with 160+ IQ i think you lack a lot of common sense. If it was that easy, BAsh wouldn’t have made this topic, would he?
[/quote]

umm, can you cut out the noobishness?

i have an iq of 164, but that makes no difference becasue i dont know much java,

as 93dcthugs93 stated, it checks if its running in a browser, in that case use simple html, and make it run your java same as runescape does…

then just have people run that html page and it will work perfectly, plus you dont have to worry about bandwith.[/quote]
Correct or like mopar said in his dirty hack =)

Read full topic

then just have people run that html page and it will work perfectly, plus you dont have to worry about bandwith.

item.title: Bot problem
item.dc:creator: @93dcthugs93 93dcthugs93
item.description:
@93dcthugs93 wrote:

This has nothing to do with the problem. It checks if it’s running in a browser. I dont think checking to see if it’s played from runescape.com has anything to do with this problem at all. Mopar are stated a decent idea on how to get around it. You all just need to read more than the first post in the topic before posting so you can see whats actually going on. Just look at mopars post he explains his dirty hack pretty well. Don’t take as me being a dick i’m jus trying to point you all in the correct direction. You would of been banned in the old rscn forums for posting something like that XD

Read full topic

item.title: Bot problem
item.dc:creator: @93dcthugs93 93dcthugs93
item.description:
@93dcthugs93 wrote:

[quote=“moparisthebest, post:2, topic:3644”]well there is about 2 ways I can think of right off hand to approach this:

  1. we can just .jar the bot and run it from a webpage
  2. [dirtyhack]we can take the jframe class, and the frame class it extends (probably just those 2 would be fine), and simply rename them to jframe1 and frame1, recompile and package up in our own package, then use them as our frames ;)[/dirtyhack][/quote]Nice idea for your dirty hack.

Read full topic
